resources.string: There are several ways by which you can change the angle value currently showing on the unit circle:
1. Touch or drag with your finger or other pointing device on the unit circle itself
2. Tap on the current angle\'s numeric value in either the degrees or radians box to enter an angle value via keyboard
3. Tap on the left/right arrows to cycle through common \"special angles\" whose radian values are expressed in terms of \u03C0

By default, all angles are represented by values in the range 0 to 360 degrees and 0 to 2\u03C0 radians. For example, the value 330 degrees will be shown instead of -30 degrees (the value of the coterminal angle)

If you would prefer that some or all angles be represented by a negative coterminal instead of the default positive value, you can go back to the main screen and click on the settings icon in the top right of the toolbar. You can then change the angle sign setting by clicking on \"Sign of angles\" in the settings menu
Within the angle sign settings menu, you will have the following options:
"All positive: all angles\' degree and radian values will be represented in the range: 0 to 360 and 0 to 2\u03C0, respectively (this is the default)"

"Top positive; Bottom negative: angles of the top half of the unit circle will be represented by degree and radian values in the range: 0 to 180 and 0 to \u03C0, respectively. Angles of the bottom half of the unit circle will be represented by degree and radian values in the range: -180 to 0 and -\u03C0 to 0, respectively"
"All negative: all angles\' degree and radian values will be represented in the range: -360 to 0 and -2\u03C0 to 0, respectively"
This application was developed on the Debian operating system
"For questions, bug reports, and support please contact: drb@dakotabarron.com"
